On 12/10/06, Jan Theodore Galkowski <jtgalkowski@...> wrote:
> But I wonder about these SUnit derivatives: Oughtn't there be investment
> in an idea that a suitably built, beautifully crafted set of tests
> should in itself consitute an executable program fulfilling its own
> requirements?

Jan,

You seem to be going in an interesting direction, but I'm left without
a clear picture.  Perhaps could you boil it down into a JUnit test
that doesn't meet your criteria of "an executable program fulfilling
its own requirements", and an equivalent program that does?  Or am I
missing the point?  Thanks,

   David Saff
